text: today's recipe is a springy and
delicious shrimp and pea risotto I'm
grading a little bit of lemon zest
that's going to flavor the broth that
I'm using to make this which adds and
even springier flavor you'll need a
teaspoon of lemon zest and you'll want
to add that to a pot with four cups of
chicken broth or fish stock if you want
and two cups of water you can certainly
make a very nice light shrimp broth with
the shells of the shrimp if you want to
but of course you may want to buy your

and a quarter teaspoon of black pepper
for the rice portion of your risotto
which is the main portion I guess you'll
want to cut up an onion you need about a

from about one small onions for risotto
I like to mince my onion as fine as
possible so that it really breaks down
in the rice and you can't really notice
it but it just infuses everything with
the delicious flavors we like to make
our risotto here in a straight sided
skillet it is one of our favorite pans
and we use it frequently for a lot of
stuff but this wide surface area really
helps with the evaporation of the liquid
which is important when you're making a
risotto do you want to saute your onion
first before you add your rice add your
onion to two tablespoons of olive oil
saute your onion you want to let it get
translucent then add one and a half cups
of arborio rice or carnaroli or viola
nanano those are all great short grains
Italian rice is perfect for risotto they
have a nice starch content they hold
their shape really well and with the
continued stirring what you get is this
really delicious creamy sauce and that
comes from using the right
right the most widely available is our
borio so pick that up when you see it at

it's nicely coated with fat a little bit

a quarter cup of white wine you can skip

but I find that it adds a delicious

completely out before you move on
happens very quickly to a hot pan and
then a pinch of saffron and then start

would say like between 1/2 cup and 3/4
of a cup at a time and you would cook

some of it evaporates and some of it is

risotto and what happens is you'll find
that you use a lot more liquid for the

it is evaporating but the constant
